H0.text: The types of waves are what the visible light spectrum can be subdivided according to.

H1.text: The sizes of particles are the basis for subdividing the visible light spectrum.

H2.text: A range of colors is how the visible light spectrum can be subdivided.

H3.text: A type of energy is what the visible light spectrum can be subdivided according to.

A4.text: The optical spectrum is sometimes considered to be the same as the visible spectrum, but some authors define the term more broadly, to include the ultraviolet and infrared parts of the electromagnetic spectrum as well, known collectively as optical radiation.

A5.text: The visible spectrum is limited to wavelengths that can both reach the retina and trigger visual phototransduction (excite a visual opsin).
